solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{_{j}_}2 \times _{l}_ + 2 \pi \times \frac{_{k}_}2 \times _{l}_ + 2\pi({\frac{_{j}_}2}^2 - {\frac{_{k}_}2}^2)\)
= _{{trunc( (pi_val*j*l)+(pi_val*k*l)+(Decimal('0.5')*pi_val*((j**2)-(k**2))), 2 )}}_\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= _{{trunc( (pi_val*j*l)+(pi_val*k*l)+(Decimal('0.5')*pi_val*((j**2)-(k**2))), 2 )}}_ \times 0.2\)
= Rs. _{{trunc( ((pi_val*j*l)+(pi_val*k*l)+(Decimal('0.5')*pi_val*((j**2)-(k**2)))) * Decimal('0.2'), 2 )}}_

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of _{j}_ cm and an inner diameter of _{k}_ cm. Its length is _{l}_ cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost of painting the pipe?
